column5: Elisa, my youngest agreed last night to help you guys out, as well as my oldest. I knew they would.  Talk soon
That's great Vince! They sound like great kids. Look forward to meeting them. Thanks again.  Elisa
I am working night shifts but will try to make it. A great event.  RR
They will keep you entertainted all day Elisa. AND i MEAN ALL DAY  Pure chatter boxes But they dont hesitate to help out.

OK .. sort of a good news bad news thing for me ... either a) I can't be there because I have to be in Vegas the next day ... in which case I could donate a pair of Tickets to the Leafs Game that night (against Pittsburg) ... for silent auction type thing... OR ... I will be there because I ditch the Vegas obligation ... but then I keep the tickets ... and donate cash ... either way count me for $100 - just let me know where to send it  TJQ let me know if you want some help around the BBQ ...or if I should charge the batteries on the Humminbird  I guess its kind of a win win really
Think we should pin this one up TJ its getting closer and I can't wait. Hope to see all of you guys again this year.
Bump
Just got a box of stuff (including an autographed reel) from Dave Mercer for the live auction at the end of the event!!!
TJ you still havent fixed this yet-- * A fishing license is required for those between 16 and 65 years of age.*
Me and my buddy will be there!  Question, I'm assuming Innisfil will waive the parking fee?
Hey guys! For the fishing derby, is it near shore? Sorry I am new to all of this . I do not have a sled so I would have to walk. Want to be there but not 100% sure of schedule. I'll get back to yah!

Yes it's within walking distance, within 1/2 km you can be in 70-80 FOW, the snow will be beate down by snowmobile travel in the area.  You can fish for the perch in a bit closer and whites a little further out.
They did last year, can't see why they wouldn't this year.  That would really make for sour cherries.
if I come will anyone wth a flasher/finder mind if me and my girlfriend tag along??  seriously though
You no.gf yes.
hmmm....gets her off my hands for a while.  I'll get back to yah
LOL @ Misfish

If you haven't seen it in the pinned section up top labeled  Two Awesome tickets to a Leafs Game... support for Fishing for Tyler Their is an online auction for these tickets and the bid is still really low. If you are a fan this is not to be missed. Besides it is for a good cause so the feel good factor is way up their too.   Art
I'd be a little leary of Brians offer, he just might "flasher her"
Haha  Look forward to this event, just a great excuse to hit the ice! Let's hope we get nice weather! Do you all recommend live minnows, and if so, is there a baitshop near by?
Corner of 89 and 11, opens at 6am.  Then keep driving up 11 to Innisfill Bch Rd, turn right and keep going until you hit the park.
Hi Everyone,  Tyler's mom here. I just got confirmation that the parking fee will be waived again this year! Yay!   Elisa
instead of having the parking fee waived, ask them to donate the fees to the tyler event!         see twocoda, sometimes i can be brilliant too!!
bump

I cant believe this is the 7th event!!  I know the French's could use some help with BBQ's again and the Prize table. If you can donate anything, time or otherwise please email Elisa at [email protected] Ill be there again this year with some surprises!!        7th Annual Fishing for Tyler Fundraiser    Tyler French is 14 years old and living with Autism Spectrum Disorder.  Autism is the fastest growing, serious developmental disability in the world and its effects have had an overwhelming impact on Tyler and his family.  We are proud to support Tyler through the:  7th Annual Ice Fishing/BBQ Fundraiser  Saturday, February 26, 2011  Innisfil Beach Park Boat Launch  Registration: 6 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., last fish measured at 1 p.m., prizes to follow  Cost: 16 years of age and over - $10 minimum donation, kids free - donations appreciated  * A fishing license is required for those between 16 and 65 years of age.*  Enjoy a BBQ lunch cooked on site  Cost: Donation  Prizes awarded for largest fish caught in various categories; lucky draw following  *All monies raised will help Tyler's parents pay for the extensive therapies that he requires, including Intensive behavioral Intervention (IBI), Speech and Language Therapy, and Occupational Therapy.*  Directions: Hwy 400 or Yonge St. to the 8th line (Innisfil Beach Rd.), east on Innisfil Beach Rd, to the end, turn left into the park, follow the road to the right, past the snack bar to the boat launch. Please park in the parking lots on the left side before boat launch.  For more information please email [email protected] or call 705-436-3607
I am 16 and I went to bps and they said you have to be 18 to get your fishing license?  http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/en/Business/LetsFish/2ColumnSubPage/STEL02_164832.html  check it out
*SMILES*
Thanks TJ and chuck and esp elisa.
Dang that sucks as usual I have plans that can not be broken I have a BOD meeting but will get some things together for the prize table.
Won't know 'till the day TJ.. but if I can, I'll be there.

blairwelsh: It was posted in a proper place as the poster for the tournament stated "* A fishing license is required for those between 16 and 65 years of age.*" However you are correct that no licence is required for those below 18 years of age or over 65.(Canadian residents)  BTW: I'll do my best to make again this year. Always a good time. Does anyone know if Innisfil will be waiving the parking fee again this year for those in the event?
Missed it last year, but, there is a good chance that we'll be there this time!!  Looking forward to meeting a bunch more OFNers in support of a good cause
I will try to make it... This would be my first.. Sounds like fun..
were thinking of going..were going to be in perrysound that weekend, so looking to see if we can get away early sat morning. Looking forward to it!
My wife and I will be there again..  6 out of 7 isnt bad...  I will donate some flies, and jigs for the cause.  dave

I'd like to thank everyone who has continued to be so supportive of Tyler and his family.  Who would have thought that what started so small 7 years ago would turn into something so spectacular.  Again thanks for the continued support.  Maureen
I plan to be there as always. Looking forward to another great event

As some of you already know, I will not be attending in body this year but in thought. What I need is for some body to take the Honor of Chef in my place. Pls remember you will not be doing this for me But "Tyler". If any one is coming from Hamilton I will be more than happy to supply the Charcoal, as long as some body is will to pick it up... Remember this is for "Tyler" So pls some body step up and take the Spatuler pls. This is a great cause as T.J. stated this is it's 7th year and started by Maureen. so pls lets make it happen again
Well once again I'll be there and this year my little girl will be joining me. Have put together some prizes and will see you all soon.
I found two young aprentices' and one other, loonietoon It would be our pleasure spatuler and service wise
Gonna have to make a concerted effort to make it this year.

Thank Vince.. If you want you can p/u the Charcoal at my place & Tylers parents have the 2 B B Q"s we used last year.. Let me know???I truly regret not being there.. but like I stated Will be there in Thought & Spirit..if nothing else..

Well, it looks like the cooking is all taken care of so this year I am going to come and fish for a change. I will also have something for the prize table. Whoever is taking care of the coffee and hot chocolate olease pm me and I'll see what I can do to help there.

Hi Everybody!  Thank you to TJ for getting me on here so I can answer some questions. Thank you to everyone for all their offers of prizes and help. The Town of Innisfil wanted us to have Tyler's fundraiser the same weekend they have Winterfest so badly they switched their weekend to ours! The next step for me is requesting to get the parking fee waived for out of town people. I will let you know how that goes. Starbucks will be supporting us again this year with coffee, hot chocolate and with many prizes. They usually provided the "big" prize. eg. last year was the fish smoker, two years ago was the fish finder.  Posca Foods has offered us hamburgers and hotdogs (personal childhood friend of mine). I haven't even sent out letters requesting help yet! I will be doing that today. I have Tyler home today so we will be wrestling for the computer. : )  I got a phone call last night from the gentleman who caught the biggest fish last year. He works at Bass Pro. He told me that his boss, Shaun Hewitt, wants me to call him and come in and see him ASAP. Apparently, Shaun has an autistic son as well.  We are hoping to have some silent auction items again this year.  Thanks everyone for your help. If you have any other questions please ask. You can also email me at [email protected].  Have a great day.
Way to go Vince!!!
Cant make it, but I'll provide some prizes again!

If anyone that is not attending and would like to donate prizes etc. I would gladly bring them up for you. That is if your in the hamilton area or guelph area. Pm me and we can make arrangements to meet up somehow. Im in the geulph area from tues to friday till 6pm. Hamilton otherwise! Sat thru Monday during the day im somewhere.  Cheers and good fishing to yas all

Just read this on Facebook:  So exciting!!! Driving into Alcona this afternoon (with Tyler) and right in front of Sobeys is a HUGE sign Winterfest Feb. 25,26,27 TYLER's FISHING DERBY is the main event!!!!!!!!!!!! Whoo Hoo!!!!!! Posted by Tyler's mom...  She also posted this on Facebook but I can't find the article she mentions...can anybody post it?  I sat down and opened up the Innisfil Examiner and there is an article about Tyler's Fishing Tournament!!! They rock!

Hi Everyone,  Sorry I haven't been on to update lately, but I have been having trouble with Tyler for the past two weeks with him being suddenly afraid to go to high school. For the time being, I am keeping him home and trying to get him into a new high school. It is very difficult to find out what is bothering him but we are fearful that someone has hurt him or he has witnessed something that has tramatized him. The high school that I am trying to get him into is very excited to have him I just have to do some red tape stuff and hopefully he will be going to a new school in a couple of weeks. It is hard to plan the tournament when he is home and on the computer! I am hoping that this week I will be able to get my focus back on the tournament again.  There was an article in the Innisfil Examiner on Friday, January 21 on the second page under community listings. It has a picture of last year's winner and under the picture it says, Lake Simcoe features some of the best ice fishing in the world and so it's not a surprise the Annual Fishing for Tyler fishing derby on Saturday morning is a favourite part of Innisfil's Winterfest.  Then under Innisfil it says, Innisfil Wnterfest has a new date -- February 25, 26 and 27, three days of fun at the Innisfil Beach Park. Event includes the annual Fishing for Tyler fishing derby on Saturday morning, and then lists a  tyke hockey tournament  on Sunday and the polar bear dip.  I will try to get a hold of the manager from Bass Pro as I haven't heard from him yet. Maybe while Tyler is in transition between schools, Tyler and I can go down to Bass Pro and visit him : ).  Prizes are coming in and thank you so much everyone for helping.
